Class LevelEditorUtil

      • snap

        public static void snap(BlockEntity snapping,
        float snapDistance)
        Snaps the given block entity to a nearby entity if it is snapDistance or less away from it.
        Parameters:
        snapping - the entity to have snap
        snapDistance - the minimum distance for a snap to occur.

      • resizeRight

        public static void resizeRight(BlockEntity resizing,
               float newX,
               float min)
        Sets the width of the BlockEntity based on its new right bounds position. Designed to be constantly called while resizing a BlockEntity.
        Parameters:
        resizing - the block entity to resize
        newX - the new X position of its right bounds
        min - the minimum allowable width

      • generatePropertyPanel

        public static <T> PropertyPanel<T> generatePropertyPanel(java.lang.Class<T> c,
                                         java.lang.String... fields)
        Generates a Java Swing compatible property panel for the given class.

        JTextFields will be generated for the given fields, but only if they meet any of the following criteria.

        1. The field is one of the eight primitive types.
        2. The field is a String type.
        3. The field is an interface or an abstract class.
        Values will be changed for an object by typing in valid input and pressing Enter. If the type is a primitive, then it will be parsed from the text and set in the currently edited object, if it is a String then the field will be set as is.

        For object types, the field will be split into a list of inputs, using spaces as the separators; the first input is expected to the be class path of an object implementation of the abstract class or interface, and the inputs afterward are used as parameters to calling the object's constructor. Problems may occur if an object has more than one constructor with the same length. (These constructors must only have primitives or String types as their arguments; if there is a constructor that contains something else, then it is ignored)

        Type Parameters:
        T - the class that the property panel is being generated for.
        Parameters:
        c - the type to generate the property panel to for.
        fields - the names of the fields to generate property editors for.
        Returns:
        the generated property panel
